content.description: <math alttext="f of x equals, the fraction with numerator x to the fourth power, plus x cubed, plus x squared, plus x, plus 1, and denominator 380 minus, the natural log of, open parenthesis, the fraction x squared plus 1, over 2, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>380</mn><mo>−</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow></mstyle><mo>⁢</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined above. The Intermediate Value Theorem applied to <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 10 comma 12, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> guarantees a solution in <math alttext="open bracket, 10 comma 12, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to which of the following equations?

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
